Articles.Content:
When browsing the various pages of this forum, I get redirected to places such as http://a.rfihub.com/sed?w=468&h=60&co=bB%3Atrue%2CisAI%3Afalse%2CisSkip%3Afalse%2Cbt%3A1402948629841%2Coptimize%3Afalse%2CscoreMicroClicks%3A0%2CexId%3A539f4c15000b37ad0a4507c625005d391%2CuG%3A0%2Curl%3Alax-56.lax-rtb1.rfihub.net%2Csej%3Afalse%2CserverId%3Alax-56%2Cmt%3A1%2CscoreMicroConversions%3A0%2CnewUser%3Afalse%2CuV%3A0%2Cuuid%3A1188105877161329734&ep=U59MFQALN60KRQfGAABdObcvk5J1ozx7pPmJoQ&ri=0e336bd4bcf5951881818a830f22a937&rs=&ai=311381&rt=230685&re=19235&ug=&pv=0&ra=9486310750.4644870769197237&rb=445&ca=&rc=13.0&rd=http%3A%2F%2Fadclick.g.doubleclick.net%2Faclk%253Fsa%253Dl%2526ai%253DCBAVVFUyfU63vLMaPlAK5uoGoAveY_-wEh6vb3H3AjbcBEAEgAFCAx-HEBGDJpquH3KPEEIIBF2NhLXB1Yi01MDAxMzQxNjgzNjMxMzYyoAGz7MfrA8gBCagDAaoEmQFP0DfrCkqzGR55WhkeVg-4eJ14_yDqzeApMM_QD30e5N2EgD8L_OUXeEfMrWL4WpvusDpXGHEqRykHL9529VlHvlLmN5inVeibUxg3UwPgwvkqWaQo4Dmsfo8YMDFlQ6AmiMAtmHyYyleE0n1fHrrRauv0oChL9Ty84P_Q9j60L-CJBOCTMhfa47HQKXDopz7IJA_5F7lcsDGABs2296KHzdLZC6AGIQ%2526num%253D1%2526sig%253DAOD64_3UPEpxu7jeLVxMs50E4kyNA_gc-A%2526client%253Dca-pub-5001341683631362%2526adurl%253D&ua=&ub=&uc=&ud=&ue=&pa=ppre9486310693589&pb=&pc=&pd=&pg=&ct=1402948631075&di=&app=0&pe=http%3A%2F%2Fgoogleads.g.doubleclick.net%2Fpagead%2Fads%3Fabl%3DCS%26client%3Dca-pub-5001341683631362%26output%3Dhtml%26h%3D60%26slotname%3D8213024102%26adk%3D2495010347%26w%3D468%26lmt%3D1402948629%26flash%3D13.0.0.206%26url%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fforum.kerbalspaceprogram.com%252Fthreads%252F83288-Problems-with-SAS-ASAS%253Fp%253D1217018%2523post1217018%26dt%3D1402948629691%26bpp%3D9%26shv%3Dr20140611%26cbv%3Dr20140417%26saldr%3Dsa%26correlator%3D1402948629743%26frm%3D20%26ga_vid%3D448248806.1402948630%26ga_sid%3D1402948630%26ga_hid%3D327400621%26ga_fc%3D0%26u_tz%3D-300%26u_his%3D14%26u_java%3D1%26u_h%3D1059%26u_w%3D1882%26u_ah%3D1012%26u_aw%3D1882%26u_cd%3D24%26u_nplug%3D0%26u_nmime%3D0%26dff%3Dtimes%2520new%2520roman%26dfs%3D13%26adx%3D1359%26ady%3D152%26biw%3D1882%26bih%3D947%26eid%3D317150304%26oid%3D3%26ref%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fforum.kerbalspaceprogram.com%252Fforums%252F15-Gamepla

Is this from the ad server? Can you make it stop?
Hmm, have you done a virus scan recently?

It's scheduled daily. (McAfee). It occasionally gets interrupted by myself or the guy who works for me, but it gets a full scan at least 4-5 times a week.

Using other virus scanners, browsers, etc is not an option. I do not and will not have admin rights. I can't even update adobe reader.
Have you tested an ad blocker to see if it is the ads causing this?

I'm sorry, that's impossible on this machine. I cannot install or change any software.

On my personal laptop I have a variety of higher level anti malware solutions, so I never see this issue. I do occasionally get warnings from Malwarebytes about blocking potentially malicious sites, but that's normal across the web. What annoys me is the redirect, which mcafee turns into "Cannot load" error page.
I don't think this is coming from the ad server, you say you can't install stuff, something could have been installed by another person who uses that machine.

Not unless IT installed it.

Nobody at this work site has admin rights. Every install and update has to be done by IT. Including updates to Adobe, Windows, Printer software, etc.

I'll try to keep track of the redirects.
Could be a virus, I mean, Macafee isn't the greatest AV.
Go to your settings and see if you have any apps/extensions installed. Thats how i got rid of ads popping up and opening new tabs.
Rifhub is the culprit, not the computer.

Rfihub seems to hijack pages here and there, you might be abel to find a fix..

https://www.google.com/search?btnG=1&pws=0&q=rfihub+hijacking+fix&gws_rd=ssl

No, rfihub is only one of may places he's being redirected to. There's malware on his computer. Probably 'rich media', but the name changes frequently as a means of disguising the malware from attempts to root it out. I had it on my PC a few months back and there were 5 different incarnations on my PC with similar sounding names. ('rich media player', 'x player', 'y media', etc etc)

It's also possible his hosts file has been contaminated.

Here's a website that might help

http://malwaretips.com/blogs/rich-media-view-virus/
Yeah you have a browser hijack trojan infection, if you don't have admin rights you'll need IT service it

It isn't malware. It's a cockup between google ad services and rifhub.

This thead has no more utility, please close.
